intro: Melampyrum doerfleri subsp. montenegrinum, commonly known as the Montenegrin touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
